intro: Trichomanes pinnatinervium, commonly known as the broad-veined holly fern, is a member of the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is a small, epiphytic fern that typically grows on tree trunks or branches in humid, shaded environments. The plant has delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive, broad network of veins. Its leaves are usually less than 10 centimeters in length and are covered in fine, silky hairs. Trichomanes pinnatinervium is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in high humidity and indirect light.
